thread.title: ‘Landfall’ by Laurie Anderson and the Kronos Quartet Review: Sounds of a Storm

author: Allan Kozinn
title: ‘Landfall’ by Laurie Anderson and the Kronos Quartet Review: Sounds of a Storm
text: Much as John Adams’s “Nixon in China” ushered in the “headline opera” subgenre, in which news stories are transformed into stage dramas, and their antagonists into mythic archetypes, Ted Hearne’s “Katrina Ballads” appears to have started a vogue for works about the destruction wrought by hurricanes and superstorms. Mr. Hearne’s 2007 score took a hard-edged look at Hurricane Katrina’s devastation of New Orleans.
